channel.title: NYT > International Home
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Wing Part May Shed Light on the Last Moments of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370
item.description: Scientists will try to prove that the part, known as a flaperon, came from the missing jet, and they hope to unlock clues about the flight’s disappearance.
item.dc:creator: MICHELLE INNIS

item.title: Kerry Urges Beijing to Halt ‘Problematic Actions’ in South China Sea
item.description: Talking with his Chinese counterpart while at a Southeast Asian meeting, the secretary of state voiced concerns about island-building in disputed waters.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry, center, looking for his place before a group photo at a meeting of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

item.title: India Floods Derail Two Trains, Killing at Least 20
item.description: Two express trains were partially swept off a flooded bridge over a river in central India overnight, killing at least 20 people and injuring 100, the government said Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS
item.media:description: Police officers and members of a rescue operation at the site of a train derailment near Harda, India, early Wednesday.

item.title: Friends of Joe Biden Worry a Run for President Could Bruise His Legacy
item.description: Few seem eager to tell the vice president of their reservations concerning a possible run for the presidency, regarded as a deeply personal decision.
item.dc:creator: CARL HULSE and JASON HOROWITZ
item.media:description: President Obama and Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. in the Oval Office. Mr. Obama is described as protective of his No. 2.

item.title: New York Officials Move to Regulate Towers Tied to Legionnaires’ Disease Outbreak
item.description: The number of cases in the Bronx rose to 86 on Tuesday, though Mayor Bill de Blasio said the pace of the outbreak had slowed.
item.dc:creator: WINNIE HU and NOAH REMNICK

item.title: Puerto Rico Has Another Debt Worry on Horizon
item.description: The government said it stopped making contributions to a fund that would pay an additional $13 billion in bond debt.
item.dc:creator: MARY WILLIAMS WALSH
item.media:description: Alejandro García Padilla, governor of Puerto Rico, said in a televised speech in June that the island’s debt was “unpayable,” and called for a “negotiated moratorium” on the debt.

item.title: Obama Begins Campaign in Congress for Iran Nuclear Deal
item.description: President Obama is rolling out a public and private campaign to build support for a nuclear deal, and to counter a well-financed onslaught from critics.
item.dc:creator: JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

item.title: New Taliban Leader Faces Discord as a Top Official Quits
item.description: The resignation of the official, the head of the group’s political office in Qatar, came amid intense debate over the appointment of the Taliban’s new commander.
item.dc:creator: MUJIB MASHAL

item.title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
item.description: Our nightly rundown will get you caught up on the day’s big stories.
item.dc:creator: ANDREA KANNAPELL and SANDRA STEVENSON

item.title: Russia Stakes New Claim to Expanse in the Arctic
item.description: Russia seeks oversight over an area including the North Pole, a region increasingly ripe for oil drilling and more as global warming melts the ice there.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW E. KRAMER

item.title: ‘I Am Definitely Not a Minimalist!’
item.description: Arnold Scaasi was known for designs that featured bright hues and prints, and had no shortage of embellishments.

item.title: Up for Sale, The Economist Is Unlikely to Alter Its Voice
item.description: The free-market British newspaper, a 50 percent stake of which is up for sale, has a complex trust system that essentially ensures its journalistic mission.
item.dc:creator: RAVI SOMAIYA
item.media:description: A London newsstand advertising The Economist. The publication has carefully shielded itself from the free market forces it so vociferously defends.

item.title: John Kasich Is In, Rick Perry Is Out in First Republican Debate
item.description: Donald Trump, Jeb Bush and Rand Paul made the cut as well, joining the other top-polling Republicans for the first debate of the 2016 presidential contest, on Fox News on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: MAGGIE HABERMAN
item.media:description: Republican presidential candidates, from left, Lindsey Graham, Ben Carson, John Kasich, Chris Christie, Bobby Jindal, Jeb Bush, and Scott Walker gathered on stage after a forum in Manchester, N.H., on Monday.

item.title: Robert Conquest, Historian Who Documented Soviet Horrors, Dies at 98
item.description: Mr. Conquest chronicled the Stalinist purges and the Ukrainian famine of the 1930s with original findings and gripping narratives.
item.dc:creator: WILLIAM GRIMES

item.title: Shire’s Offer to Buy Drug Maker Baxalta for $30 Billion Is Rebuffed
item.description: Baxalta rebuffed the approach, saying the offer “significantly undervalues” the company.
item.dc:creator: CHAD BRAY
item.media:description: The Irish drug maker Shire chose to make its proposal public.

item.title: John Leslie Munro, the Last of the World War II ‘Dambuster’ Pilots, Dies at 96
item.description: Mr. Munro, a New Zealander who was known as Les, took part in raids on heavily fortified dams in Germany in 1943, using bombs that bounced on the water before exploding.
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY
item.media:description: John Leslie Munro was in the daring "Dambusters" mission that struck at Germany's industrial heartland.

item.title: On Island of Lesbos, a Microcosm of Greece’s Other Crisis: Migrants
item.description: The number of refugees and migrants arriving on Lesbos and on other Greek islands has surged to a full-scale disaster, and only squalor awaits them.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: SUZANNE DALEY
item.media:credit: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times
item.media:description: Migrants pulled an inflatable boat crowded with Syrian refugees arriving last month from the Turkish coast on Lesbos island, Greece.

item.title: World’s Best Free Diver Vanishes in Depths
item.description: Natalia Molchanova, 53, a record-setting free diver, was presumed dead on Tuesday, her son said, after she did not surface from a dive in Spanish waters on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: ADAM SKOLNICK

item.title: Israeli Detains Meir Kahane’s Grandson, a Scion of Jewish Militancy
item.description: It was unclear whether the grandson, Meir Ettinger, was suspected of a connection to the fire that killed a toddler and ravaged two homes in the West Bank last week.
item.dc:creator: JODI RUDOREN and ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:description: Meir Ettinger, who Israeli authorities say is the head of a Jewish extremist group, appeared in court in Nazareth Illit, Israel, on Tuesday.

item.title: Catalonia Calls Election in New Bid for Secession From Spain
item.description: Catalan politicians aim to turn a regional parliamentary election scheduled for September into a plebiscite on independence.
item.dc:creator: RAPHAEL MINDER
item.media:credit: Samuel Aranda for The New York Times
item.media:description: Pro-independence graffiti in the town of Viladamat, in the Catalan countryside.
